intro: Senecio claessensii, commonly known as the Cape York Senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a dense inflorescence. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
